title: First African nations sign Artemis Accords
summary: Two African countries became the first from the continent to join the Artemis Accords as the United States works to bring more emerging space nations into the agreement.

title: Ariane 5 launches triple satellite mission to geostationary transfer orbit
summary: Arianespace launched Europe’s most advanced weather-tracking spacecraft Dec. 13 along with a pair of satellites Intelsat needs to clear C-band spectrum in the United States.

title: NASA’s Big 2022: Historic Moon Mission, Webb Telescope Images, More
summary: 2022 is one for the history books as NASA caps off another astronomical year.

title: Bill Nelson came to NASA to do two things, and he’s all out of bubblegum
summary: Working with Congress? "It's easy as pie."

title: Arianespace launches three spacecraft, Intelsat talks satellite refresh efforts
summary: Arianespace has successfully lifted three satellites into geostationary transfer orbit (GTO) on Tuesday from the Guiana Space Centre in Kourou, French Guiana using the veteran Ariane 5 launcher.

title: Quantum Space raises $15 million for cislunar spacecraft
summary: Quantum Space has raised $15 million to further development of the first in a constellation of satellites intended to provide services in cislunar space.

title: After Russia’s exit from the Lunar Gateway, NASA has found a new partner in UAE
summary: The United Arab Emirates is a founding member of the Artemis Accords.

title: United Nations General Assembly approves ASAT test ban resolution
summary: The United Nations General Assembly approved a resolution calling for a halt to one type of anti-satellite (ASAT) testing, a largely symbolic move intended to support broader space sustainability initiatives.

title: Elon’s Twitter dilemma
summary: Elon Musk used Twitter to communicate SpaceX's ascent to the top of the space industry. What happens to Musk's space ambitions now that he owns Twitter?

title: ThinkOrbital designing platform for in-space manufacturing, debris removal
summary: ThinkOrbital, a space infrastructure startup, is designing an orbital platform aimed at commercial businesses, military and government agencies that want to manufacture products in orbit or recycle debris.
